title: Muon celebrates launch of first satellite in Climate Constellation
summary: Muon Space, a Silicon Valley startup building a climate-monitoring constellation, sent its first satellite into orbit June 12 on the SpaceX Transporter-8 rideshare flight.

title: China begins constructing commercial launch pad for solid rockets
summary: China has broken ground on a new launch pad dedicated to commercial solid rockets to help boost access to launch facilities.

title: Deloitte calls on companies to draft long-term space strategies
summary: A Deloitte Space report released June 14 encourages companies in all industries to draft long-term space strategies.

title: World Economic Forum offers new debris mitigation guidelines
summary: The World Economic Forum (WEF) has released a new set of guidelines intended to reduce the creation of orbital debris with the support of some, but not all, major satellite operators.

title: U.N. opens “window of opportunity” to improve space governance
summary: A United Nations official says there is an opportunity over the next 15 months to improve how nations manage space activities to address emerging issues ranging from orbital debris to space resources.

title: Satellite execs call for more data to improve space sustainability
summary: A lack of data and collaboration continues to hold back efforts to ensure a sustainable orbital environment, satellite operator executives said June 13.

title: DARPA downsizes Blackjack space experiment
summary: The Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency on June 12 launched four satellites for a technology demonstration in low Earth orbit.

title: Artemis 2 Astronaut Completes Vision Quest
summary: Jeremy Hansen has completed a four-day Indigenous vision quest as part of his training for the Artemis 2 mission.

title: Op-ed | To Open the Space Frontier, CLD Must Not Fail
summary: NASA’s focus on human exploration beyond LEO reaching to the Moon and beyond is nothing less than thrilling. Last month, the Artemis 2 crew members were announced, and NASA has […]

title: SpaceX picks Ship 25 and Booster 9 for next Starship test flight
summary: SpaceX has selected Ship 25 and Booster 9 for the next Starship test flight as launch pad repairs and upgrades continue. Following...
